<<<<<<< HEAD
Mirrour of new reformation wherein reformers, by their owne acknowledgement, are represented ad viuum. The beauty also of their handy-worke is displayed. Epigrammes. Anderton, Lawrence, attributed name. Anderton, James, fl. 1624, attributed name.
Second edition, augmented.
158 p.
Printed by Iohn Cousturier, [Rouen] : M.DC.XXXIV. [1634]
Previously attributed to "John Brereley", i.e. James or Lawrence Anderton, but probably not by him; see "Recusant history" 16:36. An anti-protestant work. Originally published before 1634 as: Epigrammes. Half-title reads: Epigrammes. Identified as STC 17981 on UMI microfilm. Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.
=======

Second edition, augmented.
158 p.
Printed by Iohn Cousturier, [Rouen] : M.DC.XXXIV. [1634]
Previously attributed to "John Brereley", i.e. James or Lawrence Anderton, but probably not by him; see "Recusant history" 16:36. An anti-protestant work. Originally published before 1634 as: Epigrammes. Half-title reads: Epigrammes. Identified as STC 17981 on UMI microfilm. Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.
